titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation for the due execution of the office of Clarke of the Market of our houshold, and thorowout our realme of England, and dominion of Wales: and for the surveying and sealing of the constant reele appointed to be vsed by all clothiers, and workers in cloth and yarne; and for the increase of the poores wages labouring therein.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie: and by the assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: Dated at foot of sheet 5: Oatelands, the ninth day of Iuly, in the twelfth yeere of our reigne. ...
Sheet [5] has caption title: A declaration of the fees anciently belonging to the Clarke of the Market, for the execution of his office.
Sheet [6] has caption title: The fees to be taken for the sealing and sureueying of the constant reele, and for the ouersight of the increase of the poores wages, working in the making of cloth.
Arms 24; Steele notation: well well 2) and 3) of- 4) Lawes, 5) complaint 6) iid. gratis.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the Kings most excellent Maiestie: and
